data.title: Ultraman Ginga S' Moga Mogami Joins Live-Action Princess Jellyfish Drama
data.meta_description: Ultraman Ginga S' Moga Mogami joins the cast of the live-action Princess Jellyfish drama.
data.text:
The official live-action Princess Jellyfish drama website announced that former Dempaguumi.inc idol member Moga Mogami (Ultraman Ginga S, Innocent Lilies) will join the cast of the said drama.

Mogami will play the role of Kotone Kiriyama, Kuranosuke's college underclassman who is in love with him and also works in the music industry.

The series stars Kyoko Yoshine (The Anthem of the Heart) as series protagonist Tsukimi Kurashita, Koji Seto (Kamen Rider Kiva) as Kuranosuke Koibuchi, and Asuka Kudo (Lesson of the Evil) as Shu Koibuchi. Also part of the show's cast are: Rio Uchida (Kamen Rider Drive) as Mayaya, Rena Matsui (Majisuka Gakuen) as Banba, Haruka Kinami (Hero Yoshihiko) as Jiji, Eriko Tomiyama (U-31) as Chieko, and Jun Kaname (Kamen Rider Agito) as Yoshio Hanamori.

Based on Akiko Higashimura's manga of the same name, the series follows Tsukimi, a girl who loved jellyfish from a young age and is living in Amamizukan, a fangirl-only dorm. One evening at the local pet store, she sees a lovely jellyfish in danger, but a beautiful woman comes to rescue. They returned to the dorm together, only to find out that his "woman" is actually a man!

The series is directed by Junichi Ishikawa (Date, Mei-chan no Shitsuji) with scripts written by Yuichi Tokunaga (HOPE) and is airing every Mondays at 9pm on Fuji TV in Japan.
